page.title: 06St. Michael's Church
page.content: {St. Michael's Church,}Cofton Hackett, was built in l330 for the people who lived in nearby Cofton Hall and the surrounding farms. It is a small church, approximately thirty people attend each Sunday. The vicar, Rev. I. Aveyard, is the vicar of St.Andrew's Church, Barnt Green, also. As there is a{churchyard}at St. Michael's and not at St. Andrew's, some of the people of Barnt Green are buried at St. Michael's. It is a very pretty little church and with; the surrounding farmland ;it makes the{landscape}very attractive. It plays a very important part in the lives of the people of Cofton Hackettt although it is some distance out of the village.
